DOCNAME: CASE OF RADOVICI AND STANESCU v. ROMANIA [Extracts]
CONCLUSION: Preliminary objection dismissed (non-exhaustion of domestic remedies);Violation of P1-1;Pecuniary and non-pecuniary damage - financial award (global);Costs and expenses partial award - domestic proceedings
JUDGES: Alvina Gyulumyan;Corneliu Bîrsan;Egbert Myjer;John Hedigan;Vladimiro Zagrebelsky
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicants were born in DATE and DATE respectively and live in GPE .
CARDINAL . The facts of the case specific to each application , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .

CARDINAL . In DATE the applicants brought before ORG an action for recovery of possession in respect of property that had been nationalised by Decree no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL . Situated in GPE , at DATE PERSON NORP , the property consisted of a house divided into flats and the land on which it was built . At the time , CARDINAL of the flats was occupied by ORG under a tenancy agreement entered into with the ORG in DATE and extended until DATE pursuant to PERSON no . CARDINAL of DATE .

CARDINAL . In a final judgment of DATE , the court allowed the applicants’ action on the ground that the nationalisation of the property had been illegal and ordered the competent administrative authorities to return the property to them . On that date the applicants began to pay the rates and land taxes levied on their property .

CARDINAL . NORP On DATE the applicants notified E.D. of the judgment of DATE through the intermediary of a bailiff and by registered letter with return receipt , in accordance with PERSON no . ORG of DATE . In their notice , the applicants requested PERSON to enter into a tenancy agreement with them , as the new owners of the flat that E.D. occupied , and informed her , for the payment of the rent , of the details of a bank account in their names with ORG .

CARDINAL . In DATE , after the entry into force of Government Emergency Ordinance no . CARDINAL of DATE , the applicants visited PERSON , who had declined to respond to their request , with a view to entering into a tenancy agreement with her ; they were faced with a categorical refusal on the part of ORG

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicants brought proceedings for the eviction of ORG in ORG . They claimed that ORG was occupying their property without any right of tenancy and had refused to enter into a tenancy agreement with them or to pay them rent in that connection . They further complained that ORG had been breeding pigs in the basement of the house , thus damaging it and rendering it insalubrious .

CARDINAL . In a judgment of DATE , ORG granted their application and ordered the eviction of ORG from the disputed property . It found that ORG had not requested an extension of her tenancy of the flat occupied by her and her family , which she had been entitled to do under LAW no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL and which would have enabled her to enter into an agreement with the new landlords . The court further observed that the applicants had not complied with the obligation under LAW of the GPE to notify the tenant , within DATE from the entry into force of the Ordinance , through the intermediary of a bailiff and by registered letter with return receipt , of the date and place fixed for the signing of a tenancy agreement .

CARDINAL . Whilst the court observed that , under LAW of the GPE , failure by a landlord to comply with those formalities resulted in the extension of the previous tenancy until the signing of a new agreement , it nevertheless considered that this provision was not applicable in the present case in view of the exception provided for by LAW whereby there was no extension in the event of a dispute arising from a tenant ’s refusal to enter into a tenancy agreement with the new landlord . The court thus considered that the applicants had adduced evidence of the refusal by ORG to enter into such an agreement . Accordingly , it held that that existing tenancy agreement had not been extended and that ORG was occupying the applicants’ property without any right of tenancy .

CARDINAL . In a judgment of CARDINAL DATE , ORG upheld the merits of that judgment on appeal . It considered that the court below had correctly applied LAW ) of the GPE , finding that the existing tenancy agreement had not been extended in view of the refusal by ORG , as proven by the applicants , to enter into a new agreement with them as the new landlords .

CARDINAL . In a final judgment of DATE , ORG granted an appeal by the defendant and dismissed the applicants’ action . It found that the applicants had failed to comply , when serving their notice on ORG requesting her to enter into a tenancy agreement , with the conditions and formalities laid down in LAW , and accordingly held that the existing tenancy agreement between ORG and the ORG had been automatically extended pursuant to LAW . The reasoning in the judgment made no mention of the applicability in the present case of LAW d ) of the GPE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicants brought proceedings against ORG seeking from her the payment of compensation for having deprived them of the enjoyment of the flat in their house that the defendant had occupied since DATE without paying them any rent .

CARDINAL . In a judgment of DATE , ORG dismissed their application on the ground that the defendant had a tenancy agreement with the ORG , which had been extended automatically as the applicants had failed to comply with the formalities provided for in LAW . That judgment became final on an undetermined date , after being upheld by ORG on an appeal by the applicants .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicants brought eviction proceedings against ORG in ORG on the ground that she had been occupying a flat , of which they were the owners , without paying them any rent , and that her conduct was such that her cohabitation with the other occupants of the building had become impossible . The applicants indicated that , after they had been granted the return of their property by the final judgment of DATE , they had made a number of attempts to enter into a tenancy agreement with the defendant , who had constantly behaved aggressively towards them , but had been unsuccessful . They referred to a number of complaints that they had filed against ORG with law - enforcement agencies . They relied on section CARDINAL(b ) of PERSON no . ORG taken in conjunction with LAW ( i ) of the GPE .

CARDINAL . In a judgment of DATE , ORG dismissed their action as manifestly ill - founded . It considered that , as it concerned the termination of a tenancy agreement , they should have proved that they had entered into such an agreement with the defendant and that there were circumstances which rendered her cohabitation with the other occupants of the building impossible , but that they had failed to adduce such evidence . The reasoning in this judgment made no reference to the ORG complaint concerning ORG ’s failure to pay rent .

CARDINAL . The applicants appealed against that judgment . In a final judgment of DATE , ORG granted their application . It held that ORG had been occupying their property without any right of tenancy , taking into account the fact that the defendant had prevented the connection of the flat to the town gas network and had impeded the use by the other tenants of the common parts of the building , as a result of which her tenancy agreement was not being automatically extended . The court consequently ordered her eviction from the flat that she had been occupying in the applicants’ building .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicants lodged an action for eviction against the members of ORG ’s family who had been living with her in the flat . Their application was granted by a final judgment of CARDINAL DATE , which ordered the eviction from the flat of the members of ORG ’s family .

CARDINAL . On DATE a bailiff from ORG service for the execution of judgments went to the applicants’ flat and restored possession of the LOC to them after breaking the locks on the front door to gain access . The bailiff noted in the record drawn up DATE that serious damage had been done to the flat , in which several window panes were missing or broken .
CARDINAL . The applicants never received any rent for the flat which ORG had occupied in their building DATE and DATE .
CARDINAL . The relevant provisions of domestic law read as follows at the material time .
CARDINAL . Section CARDINAL of Law no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL provided :
“ The tenant shall lose the right to occupy the leased accommodation and shall be evicted in the following cases :
( d ) If , in bad faith , he or she has failed for a period of DATE to pay the rent or the service charges .
The tenant ’s eviction , in the cases provided for in this section , shall be ordered by a decision of the courts . ”
CARDINAL . Section CARDINAL of Law no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL read as follows :

“ Regardless of the type of landlord , any residential tenancy agreement concerning housing of which the lease is governed by PERSON no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL ... , and which is in progress at the time of the entry into force of the present PERSON , shall automatically be extended for a period of DATE under the same conditions [ as those laid down in PERSON no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL ] . ”
CARDINAL . The relevant sections of PERSON no . ORG read as follows :
“ The lease of residential premises shall be granted under an agreement between landlord and tenant recorded in writing and registered with the local tax authorities ... ”
“ Should the parties fail to agree on the renewal of the tenancy agreement , the tenant shall be required to vacate the premises on the expiry of his or her tenancy . ”
“ Tenancy agreements shall be terminated prior to their expiry date in the following cases :
( b ) at the request of the landlord , should the tenant fail to pay the rent for DATE ;
( i ) when the tenant ’s conduct renders impossible his or her cohabitation with the other occupants of the building or prevents the normal use of the LOC ;
CARDINAL . The relevant Articles of the Ordinance read as follows :

“ The term of a residential tenancy agreement ... concerning LOC that have been returned to their former owner shall be extended at the request of the tenant for a maximum period of DATE from the date on which the present Ordinance comes into force . ”

“ A new tenancy agreement shall be entered into between the landlord and the tenant at the tenant ’s request . The private landlord shall register the new tenancy agreement with the local tax authorities . The legal entity that previously possessed or administered the property shall inform the tenant under the existing tenancy agreement , by letter with return receipt , within DATE after the return of the property , that he or she may from DATE enter into a new tenancy agreement with the landlord to whom the property has been returned . ”

“ The landlord shall notify the tenant , within DATE following the entry into force of the present Ordinance and through the intermediary of a bailiff , of the date and place fixed for the signing of a new tenancy agreement . The notice shall be served by registered letter with return receipt . ... ”

“ Failure by the landlord to comply with the provisions of LAW shall lead to the automatic extension of the existing tenancy agreement until the parties have entered into a new agreement . Failure by the tenant to pay rent until the signing of the new agreement may not be relied upon by the landlord as a ground for eviction .

In the event that , within DATE following the date of receipt of the notice , the tenant fails to reply in writing or refuses without justification to enter into a new tenancy agreement , the landlord shall be entitled to seek the unconditional eviction of the tenant ... by presidential decree . ”
“ The tenancy agreement shall not be extended :

( d ) in the event of a dispute resulting from the refusal of the tenant , after being notified pursuant to LAW . CARDINAL/CARDINAL , NORP or ORG , to enter into a new tenancy agreement with the landlord ;
( i ) where the tenant renders cohabitation impossible or impedes the normal use of the dwelling ;

“ The amount of the rent shall be fixed by negotiation between the tenant and the landlord at the time they enter into the new tenancy agreement . The rent shall not exceed PERCENT of the DATE net income of the household if this income does not exceed the average DATE net salary nationwide . ”

CARDINAL . Law no . CARDINAL of CARDINAL DATE approved Government Emergency Ordinance no . CARDINAL and amended its LAW , raising to DATE the term of the tenancy agreement extended at the request of the tenant where the property had been returned to its former owner . The PERSON also amended LAW by providing that the rent to be paid by the tenant could not exceed PERCENT of the DATE net income of his household .

CARDINAL . Government Emergency Ordinance no . CARDINAL ceased to be in effect on DATE . Under Government Emergency Ordinance no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL , only tenancy agreements concerning premises belonging to the ORG could be extended by DATE , at the request of the tenant .
